page.title: 04PHYSICAL LANDSCAPE-GALSTON
page.content: Galston is situated in the Irvine Valley,probably built up around a ford in the River Irvine.The river has shaped a mature wide valley.The valley side to the North has an average gradient of 1:19 and the valley side to the South 1:36.The river has greatly helped to develop Galston providing a source of energy for the early mills,but it also has hindered mining with serious flooding problems. The land on which Galston stands has a surface drift of sand and gravel,drumlins and boulder clay.The solid geology is carboniferous limestone series and coal measures.Also there are traces of basalt,dolerite plugs and teschenite sills which form a series of waterfalls on the Burnawn.Also various types of agate have been found here.
